required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Intravenous Iron vs. Oral Iron Supplementation for Postpartum Anemia
clinical_study.official_title: A Feasibility Trial of Intravenous Iron vs. Oral Iron Supplementation for the Treatment of Postpartum Anemia (IVIRONMAN)

lead_sponsor.agency: The University of Texas Medical Branch, Galveston

clinical_study.source: The University of Texas Medical Branch, Galveston

brief_summary.textblock:
This trial will be a comparative pragmatic open label feasibility randomized controlled trial of oral daily versus IV iron in anemic postpartum patients.
Two randomly assigned groups will be compared during the postpartum period:
1. Oral Iron group: Ferrous sulfate 325 mg (65 mg elemental iron) by mouth for a total of 6 weeks TID.
IV placebo in sodium chloride 0.9% 500mL IV infusion will be given before discharge home over 1 hour preceded by placebo test dose IV infusion of 100mL 0.9% sodium chloride.
2. IV Iron group: Low molecular weight iron dextran (infed) 1000mg in sodium chloride 0.9% 500mL IV infusion over 1 hour preceded by test dose 25 mg IV low molecular weight iron dextran infusion in 100mL 0.9% sodium chloride.
2.1 Oral placebo will be given by mouth for a total of 6 weeks TID.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)
study_design_info.masking_description: Double blinded placebo controlled clinical trial. We will be using intravenous and oral placebos for each interventions

secondary_outcome.description: feeling sick to vomit or vomit

arm_group.description: Ferrous sulfate 325 mg (65 mg elemental iron) by mouth for a total of 6 weeks three times daily. Intravenous placebo in sodium chloride 0.9% 500mL IV infusion will be given before discharge home over 1 hour preceded by placebo test dose IV infusion of 100mL 0.9% sodium chloride.

Low molecular weight iron dextran (infed) 1000mg in sodium chloride 0.9% 500mL IV infusion over 1 hour preceded by test dose 25 mg IV low molecular weight iron dextran infusion in 100mL 0.9% sodium chloride. Oral placebo will be given by mouth for a total of 6 weeks TID.

intervention.description: one tablet 325 milligrams three times a day

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Delivery at our institution
- Hemoglobin below 9 g/dl in postpartum day 1
- Singleton gestation
Exclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of malabsorptive disorder or history of gastric bypass procedure
- Known diagnosis of anemia other than iron deficiency (thalassemia, macrocytic anemia, sickle cell, etc.)
- Significant cardiovascular disease, including but not limited to myocardial infarction or unstable angina within 6 months prior to study inclusion or current history of NYHA Class III or IV congestive heart failure
- Patient has received blood transfusion or there is a plan to transfuse
- Lactose intolerance

eligibility.gender_description: Participant eligibility is based on self-representation of gender identity.

clinical_study.keyword: Postpartum, iron deficiency anemia, intravenous iron
